text:
I am trying to get the JProbe tasks working on Solaris 8 with JProbe 3.0.1.  

I ran into two major problems:

1. Apparently the JProbe installation directory structure differs in that the 
directory names are all lowercase (on Windows they are title case).
2. The jpcovreport caused null pointer exceptions deep in the guts of Xalan.

I tracked down problem (2) above to an apparent platform difference in the 
compiler (odd since I was using the same JDK on Windows and Solaris).  On 
Windows the compilers add an attribute to the class files they generate 
indicating the name of the source file.  On Solaris, this attribute is not 
present.

I am attaching a patch to this defect report that fixes the above problems, and 
cleans up some file access a little.

With this patch, the sitraka tasks all work on Solaris, but it is very slow 
(about 25 time normal execution time).  Still working with Sitraka to figure 
that out.
creator: garrick.olson@aceva.com

Fixed in HEAD.
About Xalan what is the problem ? What version are you using ?

I'm wondering if it is not a systemid problem. The current way to build the 
systemid in the code is not correct on Unix (in Sitraka tasks), but not doing 
it this way caused version previous to 2.2D9 to fail miserably. The code was 
fixed in Xalan for D9 (there was inconsistencies and URI specs are far from 
being crystal clear but now there is some legacy code here and there)

For more info see http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=xalan-dev&m=99730890710885&w=2

For now I set this bug to fixed. Thanks for the patch !

I am using Xalan 2.1.0.  It throws a null pointer exception when you call 
Element.setAttribute("blah", null) and then transform the document to XML 
(which the jpcovreport task did when the source file attribute was missing).
